content: I'm trying to build a copy of rustc that offers rust-lld. I have [rust] lld = true in my config.toml, but I'm failing with cmake errors when it tries to build. Is there anything special required to build lld?
I'm also surprised that cmake is involved at all, since it first pestered me to install ninja...
nevermind, I did x clean and it seems to work, I must have had cmake junk left over from before I installed ninja

wait, no, it's just failing with prettier errors :P
stuff like fatal error: llvm/Support/Caching.h: No such file or directory, which makes no sense to me why LLVM wouldn't be finding certain files
does git status tell you that src/llvm-project has modified files?

bstrie said:

I'm also surprised that cmake is involved at all, since it first pestered me to install ninja...

cmake generates build.ninja files that ninja then uses to compile the .c++ code, the same way cmake can generate Makefiles
